q:
Tara is working on an ASP.NET Web application. She is learning about MVC and the 3-tier architecture in ASP.NET and wants to put her knowledge to the test, then which of the following options is the correct difference between the MVC and 3-tier architecture?

Options:

  1. MVC is a software design pattern while 3-tier architecture is not.
  2. The 3-tier architecture is a client-server architecture that divides the app into user interface, business object layer, and data access layer while the MVC divides an app into model, view, and controller.
  3. Both of these
  4. None of these
